content.description:
Fun opening moves lead to... something. I'm not sure what. I probably need to hang a TR on this to clean the upper half...which would be an adventure all of its own.

Anyways, you start on a big, open sidepull, paste feet, and monkey for a small bucket where the horizontal crack cuts across. There's a gravel-filled jug up and left from here.

It looks like the logical place to call it a route would be 2-3 moves past this point, although I haven't really resolved the descent, since this line would not top out without being severely X-rated.

I clearly haven't thought this through. If you want to finish it, go for it and shoot me a PM with the details.
content.location: Look for a comfy sidepull rail left of the juniper bush.

content.description:
Sit start on big sidepulls, stand up to a mail-slot finger bucket, then look for big holds up on the slab.

Downclimb or jump off.

It's a half-star problem.
content.protection: A pad is not really necessary.
content.location: This is left of the big hanging block (see the area photo).

content.description: Start on the left side of the formation in a big, horizontal crack. Go right past the juniper until you reach the end of the overhanging section.

An endearingly awkward problem.

Grab the hanging block, and wrestle your way up to a nice finger bucket. Do a flying crotch-mantel that strands you in midair, legs dangling uselessly. Plant a foot somewhere and you're done.

I still need to figure out the last move before I can claim the FA, but it's not on my priority list. So if you feel like doing it first, by all means go for it and PM me.

A sit start would be burly, but you might need to clean off some rotten rock to find it.
content.protection: Pad to keep your shoes clean. The landing is perfect.
content.location: Look for the microwave-sized hanging block at head level.

pathTokens: South Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
